business.headline: Sensex falls over 100 points, Nifty below 24,800; Tata Steel gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 63.52 points to 81,378.52, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 16.70 points to 24,734.20 as of 9:25 am.

Sensex and Nifty likely to rise on RBI rate cut hopesAnalysts predict a rate cut in RBI's MPC announcement. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,849.50 as of 8:30 am, indicating that Nifty50 will open above Thursday's close of 24,750.90.
Stocks to watch on June 6 as RBI rate cut anticipatedInvestors will have several stocks in focus as the Reserve Bank of India is expected to announce a rate cut, potentially boosting the market.

Tesla's worst day ever: $152 billion wiped out after Musk-Trump falloutTesla's market capitalisation fell below the $1 trillion mark and ended the day at $916 billion, its biggest single-day loss in value ever.

Tesla shares fall 14% as Musk-Trump feud rattles investorsTesla shares plunged 14% as the Elon Musk–Donald Trump bromance ended and their feud spilled into the open, wiping out $150 billion in market value and weighing on Wall Street despite optimism over tariff talks.

India could become third largest economy in the world this year: Borge BrendeIn an exclusive interview with India Today, World Economic Forum President and CEO Borge Brende talked about India's strong economic performance and projected it could become the world's third-largest economy this year.

Tariffs, wars, AI: WEF chief breaks down what's next for global economyFrom rising tariffs and geopolitical risks to AI-driven productivity leaps, WEF CEO Borge Brende reveals how resilience, innovation, and cautious optimism could shape the future of the global economy beyond 2025

India is world's bright spot, set to overtake Japan: WEF chief Borge BrendeWEF CEO Borge Brende said India is the world's bright spot but added that to stay ahead, it must double down on reforms, infrastructure, and coordination across states.

Delhi Airport gives seed balls to flyers, merges green goals with social impactLed by GMR Aero's Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL), the campaign invites passengers to plant seed balls containing species like Lemon, Tamarind, Gooseberry, Neem, and Peepal, all chosen for their ecological and medicinal value.
Want to update your credit card email? Follow these stepsA guide to updating your registered email address for credit cards in India, highlighting the new RBI KYC norms and simplification by banks.

Tata to handle iPhone and MacBook repairs in India for Apple: ReportAs the US tech giant continues to diversify its manufacturing footprint beyond China, Tata has emerged as a key ally. The group already assembles iPhones at three facilities in southern India, with one also manufacturing certain components.
Will energy replace currency? Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath thinks soNikhil Kamath believes energy could replace money in the next decade. Here's why he thinks so.

entertainment.headline: Malayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko admitted to hospital after accident in Tamil NaduMalayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko admitted to hospital after accident in Tamil Nadu

Rana Daggubati reacts to viral video of him getting angry at paps | ExclusiveActor Rana Daggubati was caught on camera confronting paparazzi at Mumbai airport, sparking debate about celebrity privacy. In an exclusive chat with India Today, he expressed his discomfort with invasive filming and called for respectful content creation.

Akshay-Tiger's stylish bike entry goes viral, ahead of Housefull 5 release. WatchActors Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff made a grand entry on a bike at an event, leaving fans thrilled with their stylish appearance. The moment went viral just ahead of the release of 'Housefull 5', which is already generating massive buzz and strong advance bookings.

Ranbir Kapoor's new clean-shaven look sends Internet into frenzy. WatchActor Ranbir Kapoor's new clean-shaven and slim look is going viral, and he is looking different from his 'Animal' appearance. He also won hearts by being sweet to fans and paparazzi, ahead of his role as Lord Ram in 'Ramayana'.

Exclusive: Jackson Wang is finally coming to India on June 10; details insideGlobal pop icon Jackson Wang is all set to visit Mumbai on June 10 for a week-long promotional tour and cultural immersion. Read exclusive details.

Thug Life box office Day 1: Kamal Haasan's film fails to beat Indian 2, VikramDirector Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan and Silambarasan, opened at the box office on a solid note. However, the film failed to surpass the Day 1 collection of Haasan's previous films, 'Indian 2' and 'Vikram'.

Panchayat Season 4 to arrive early? Manju Devi vs Kranti Devi promo suggests soThe rivalry between Manju Devi and Kranti Devi takes a new twist in the rally cry song of 'Panchayat Season 4'. The video hints at the show releasing ahead of the July 2 launch date.

Ayushmann Khurrana's next with Sooraj Barjatya to go on floors in November: ReportAyushmann Khurrana will play the lead role of 'Prem' in Sooraj Barjatya's next family drama, which begins shooting in November 2025. The film, also starring Sharvari, is expected to release in the second half of 2026.

Farah Khan's cook Dilip shares chocolates with paps before first foreign trip. WatchFarah Khan's in-house cook Dilip is now a social media sensation. He was seen at the airport ahead of his first international trip.

Ranjeet shares birthday fun from Housefull 5 sets: Can't stop missing these momentsVeteran actor Ranjeet recently shared a throwback clip of his birthday celebrations from the sets of Housefull 5. Akshay Kumar, Riteish Deshmukh, Abhishek Bachchan, and others were seen celebrating with him.

Akshay Kumar wasn't the first choice for Jaanwar: Suneel DarshanFilmmaker Suneel Darshan revealed that Akshay Kumar was not the original lead for Jaanwar. The director had initially considered two other Bollywood actors before casting Akshay during a low point in his career.

Aamir Khan confirms superhero film with director Lokesh Kanagaraj. DetailsAamir Khan is set to work with Tamil director Lokesh Kanagaraj for his next superhero film. The actor confirmed the development and the film will go on the floors somewhere in the second half of 2026.

Ishaan Khatter addresses rift with The Royals makers over shirtless scenesActor Ishaan Khatter recently opened up about his rift with 'The Royals' makers over his shirtless scenes. Khatter said that he resisted certain scenes, however, they persisted.

Muzammil Ibrahim says he was in a relationship with Deepika Padukone for 2 yearsActor Muzammil Ibrahim recently revealed he dated Deepika Padukone for two years during their early modelling days in Mumbai. He shared fond memories of their time together, including rickshaw dates and birthday surprises, and expressed admiration for her success today.

Actor Barun Sobti confirms Asur 3 in worksActor Barun Sobti created strong buzz among fans after he gave an update on his popular series 'Asur'. He stated that the third part of the franchise is in the works.

Pankaj Tripathi, Aditi Rao Hydari team up for Parivarik ManuRanjanActors Pankaj Tripathi and Aditi Rao Hydari are set to share the screen space for the first time in Parivarik ManuRanjan. The shooting of the film has begun in Lucknow.

Sitaare Zameen Par: Aamir Khan is a playful coach in fun, slice-of-life title trackThe 'Sitaare Zameen Par' title track was released on June 5. Aamir Khan plays a caring and playful basketball coach in the slice-of-life song celebrating team-spirit and human resilience.

Actor Muzammil Ibrahim accuses Pooja Bhatt of abuse on Dhokha set 18 years agoActor Muzammil Ibrahim recently recalled his unpleasant experience of working under actor-filmmaker Pooja Bhatt's direction. He alleged that due to Pooja's abusive behaviour, he decided not to work with her in the near future.

Kamal Haasan fans defy Thug Life ban in Karnataka, travel 42 km to watch the filmActor Kamal Haasan's 'Thug Life' was banned in Karnataka following his controversial comment about the Kannada language. However, fans from Bengaluru travelled to Hosur, Tamil Nadu, to watch the film and show their support.

general news.headline: RCB marketing head arrested, event firm officials detained over killer stampedeBengaluru police have arrested RCB marketing head Nikhil Sosale and detained three officials of event organising in connection with the stampede that killed 11 people. The action comes after the Karnataka government suspended top police officers amid criticism of mismanagement.

Tesla's worst day ever: $152 billion wiped out after Musk-Trump falloutTesla's market capitalisation fell below the $1 trillion mark and ended the day at $916 billion, its biggest single-day loss in value ever.

When unstoppable ego met immovable megalomaniac: Trump-Musk breakup in 4 ActsMusk bankrolled Trump's return to power, stood by him on election night, and was crowned a 'super genius' from the inaugural podium. But in just six months, Musk went from kingmaker to enemy number one — as ego clash led to a breakup that rocked Washington and Wall Street alike.

He does this to his dad, Shashi Tharoor quips after son's curveball on Op SindoorThe question from Shashi Tharoor's son, both timely and probing, was whether any country had asked the Indian delegation for evidence of Pakistan's involvement in the Pahalgam attack, given Pakistan's repeated denials.

Operation Sindoor: United abroad, divided at homeWhen an all-party meeting is called to discuss Operation Sindoor, the prime minister doesn't even attend it. Now, when a special session is demanded on the post-Pahalgam situation, the government ignores the plea. When debate is strangulated, democracy is weakened.

Cricket body told Karnataka government about Vidhana Soudha event, shows letterThe Karnataka State Cricket Association had first written to the state government on June 3, asking for permission to hold a felicitation ceremony at Vidhana Soudha.

PM Modi to unveil world's highest railway bridge over River Chenab todayPrime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the Chenab Railway Bridge, the world's highest railway arch, and India's first cable-stayed rail bridge at Anji, completing a decades-long effort to connect the Kashmir Valley to the rest of the country by rail.

News Menu, June 6: PM's mega infra push in J&K Trump- Elon Musk feud escalatesPM Modi will inaugurate the record-setting railway bridge over the Chenab River in Jammu and Kashmir, the Bengaluru stampede is expected to dominate headlines with more reactions, and Rahul Gandhi is set to visit Bihar today. This and more in India's news menu today.

Musk vs Trump: Will it affect Indian astronaut's launch to space?Elon Musk briefly threatened to decommission SpaceX's Dragon spacecraft after a public spat with Donald Trump over federal contracts, raising concerns over ISS missions and US-India space collaboration.
Malayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko admitted to hospital after accident in Tamil NaduMalayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko admitted to hospital after accident in Tamil Nadu

Trump vs Musk feud erupts with Epstein bomb and SpaceX threatElon Musk and President Trump's alliance collapsed in a fiery feud, with Musk announcing the end of SpaceX's Dragon program after Trump threatened his contracts. Their clash, sparked by a controversial bill, escalated with Epstein allegations and personal attacks.

Trump says he's disappointed with Elon Musk, billionaire says 'Whatever'Donald Trump suggested that Elon Musk's opposition to the 'One Big Beautiful Bill' stemmed from the bill's plan to phase out federal consumer tax credits for EVs, a measure that would directly impact Tesla.

Why arbitrary-versary might be killing the romance in your relationshipRelationship experts believe that remembering an anniversary isn't strictly necessary. What is of more importance is genuine care, attention and understanding.

Housefull 5 Movie Review and Release Live Updates: Two climaxes, double the funHousefull 5 Review And Release Live Updates: The 'Housefull' franchise is back with its fifth instalment. The fifth part, directed by Tarun Mansukhani, features a star-studded cast including Akshay Kumar, Riteish Deshmukh, Abhishek Bachchan and Sanjay Dutt among others.

Akshay-Tiger's stylish bike entry goes viral, ahead of Housefull 5 release. WatchActors Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff made a grand entry on a bike at an event, leaving fans thrilled with their stylish appearance. The moment went viral just ahead of the release of 'Housefull 5', which is already generating massive buzz and strong advance bookings.

Musk says SpaceX to decommission Dragon spacecraft amid Trump feud, then a U-turnElon Musk announced SpaceX will retire its Dragon spacecraft after President Trump threatened to cut government contracts. The move follows Trump's public criticism of Musk and growing tensions over political differences, marking a sharp break between the former allies amid a heated feud.

So grateful: Trinamool's Mahua Moitra marries ex-BJD MP Pinaki Misra in GermanyMahua Moitra and BJD leader Pinaki Misra, both sitting Lok Sabha members, have reportedly married in a quiet overseas ceremony.

Seemanth Singh is new Bengaluru top cop after Siddaramaiah's action over stampedeHours after the Karnataka government suspended Bengaluru Police Commissioner B Dayananda over the stampede during RCB's victory celebrations, IPS officer Seemanth Kumar Singh has been named as the new top cop of the city.

India is world's bright spot, set to overtake Japan: WEF chief Borge BrendeWEF CEO Borge Brende said India is the world's bright spot but added that to stay ahead, it must double down on reforms, infrastructure, and coordination across states.

Police made scapegoats: Karnataka BJP slams Congress over Bengaluru stampedeThe BJP has accused the Karnataka Congress government of scapegoating senior Karnataka police officials after 11 people died in a stampede at RCB's IPL victory event in Bengaluru.

AI's dirty secret: How your chatbot is draining Earth's water and energyArtificial Intelligence might feel like magic, but it's powered by very real, very energy-hungry machines. Training a single large AI model like GPT-4 can emit as much CO₂ as five cars over their lifetime. Behind every chatbot answer or AI-generated image lies massive server farms, often powered by non-renewable energy sources.

Japan's ispace confirms Resilience lander crashed on the MoonThe mission, which aimed to make history by achieving the first private Japanese soft landing in the Moon's far north, instead became the company's second failed attempt in as many years.

Russian drones hit Kyiv, set residential buildings on fire amid missile warningRussian drones struck Kyiv early Friday, igniting fires in residential buildings across multiple districts. Authorities warned of possible missile attacks as air defences responded, and emergency crews assessed damage and casualties.

Trump threatens to cut Elon Musk's government contracts amid escalating feudPresident Trump threatened to cancel federal contracts and subsidies for Elon Musk's companies, escalating their feud after Musk criticised his spending bill and claimed Trump wouldn't have won without him.

sports.headline: French Open Day 13 schedule: Djokovic takes on Sinner, Alcaraz faces Musetti testThe men's singles semi-finals will take centre stage on Friday, June 6 as Novak Djokovic will square off against World No.1 Jannik Sinner, while defending champion Carlos Alcaraz will face the in-form Lorenzo Musetti.

Kohli's Test retirement driven by mental fatigue, not poor form: Greg ChappellFormer Australia cricketer Greg Chappell has revealed the real reason behind Virat Kohli's Test retirement, saying that the star batter bid adieu to the longest format due to lack of clarity and not poor form.

New Zealand name former South Africa coach Rob Walter as Gary Stead replacementRob Walter has been named as the new New Zealand head coach of the men's national team after Gary Stead left after his 7-year tenure came to an end. Walter worked as the head coach of the South Africa team till April this year.

Shubman Gill will be reborn as Test batter at Virat Kohli's position: Deep DasguptaFormer India cricketer-turned commentator Deep Dasgupta has backed Shubman Gill to be reborn as a Test batter at Virat Kohli's batting position in the upcoming tour of England.

KL Rahul's red-ball return in focus in final unofficial Test vs England LionsKL Rahul will aim to make the most of his first red-ball game in months ahead of the Test series against England. India A will take on England Lions in the second and final unofficial Test starting in Northampton on Friday.

Novak Djokovic vs Jannik Sinner: All you need to know about semis French Open 2025: 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic will be up against World No.1 Jannik Sinner in the semi-final of the clay-court major on June 6 at Court Philippe-Chatrier.

Gauff ends French wildcard's fairytale, sets up final vs Swiatek-slayer SabalenkaWorld No. 2 Coco Gauff brought an end to French wildcard Lois Bosson's dream run with a commanding win in their women's singles semi-final on Thursday. Earlier in the day in Paris, Aryna Sabalenka stunned Iga Swiatek, snapping the Polish star's 26-match unbeaten streak on the red clay.

England pacer Brydon Carse reveals he considered toe amputation amid injury woesEngland pacer Brydon Carse has said he contemplated amputating a toe to overcome a persistent and painful injury that kept him out of action for months.

Swiatek fortunate for dominant French Open run after rare loss vs SabalenkaIga Swiatek's 26-match winning streak at the French Open came to a screeching halt as her title defence ended on Thursday, but the Pole said she was happy to have enjoyed a glorious run at the claycourt Grand Slam.

Not fazed by Bazball, Shubman Gill aims to craft own Test captaincy styleSpeaking in Mumbai on the eve of India's departure to England, new Test captain Shubman Gill said he will be focussed on maintaining clairty and comfort in the dressing room. Gill will lead India in a five-Test series, starting June 20.

Novak Djokovic vs Jannik Sinner: When and where to watch semifinalFrench Open 2025: 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic and World No.1 Jannik Sinner will lock horns in the second men's singles semi-finals on Friday, June 6 at Court Philippe-Chatrier.

Gauff ends French wildcard's fairytale, sets up final vs Swiatek-slayer SabalenkaWorld No. 2 Coco Gauff brought an end to French wildcard Lois Bosson's dream run with a commanding win in their women's singles semi-final on Thursday. Earlier in the day in Paris, Aryna Sabalenka stunned Iga Swiatek, snapping the Polish star's 26-match unbeaten streak on the red clay.

England pacer Brydon Carse reveals he considered toe amputation amid injury woesEngland pacer Brydon Carse has said he contemplated amputating a toe to overcome a persistent and painful injury that kept him out of action for months.

Swiatek fortunate for dominant French Open run after rare loss vs SabalenkaIga Swiatek's 26-match winning streak at the French Open came to a screeching halt as her title defence ended on Thursday, but the Pole said she was happy to have enjoyed a glorious run at the claycourt Grand Slam.

Not fazed by Bazball, Shubman Gill aims to craft own Test captaincy styleSpeaking in Mumbai on the eve of India's departure to England, new Test captain Shubman Gill said he will be focussed on maintaining clairty and comfort in the dressing room. Gill will lead India in a five-Test series, starting June 20.

Novak Djokovic vs Jannik Sinner: When and where to watch semifinalFrench Open 2025: 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic and World No.1 Jannik Sinner will lock horns in the second men's singles semi-finals on Friday, June 6 at Court Philippe-Chatrier.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
